verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>, when he fled <WH1272> from <WH6440> Absalom <WH53> his son <WH1121>. LORD <WH3068>, how are they increased <WH7231> that trouble <WH6862> me! many <WH7227> are they that rise up <WH6965> against me.
Many <WH7227> there be which say <WH559> of my soul <WH5315>, There is no help <WH3444> for him in God <WH430>. Selah <WH5542>.
But thou, O LORD <WH3068>, art a shield <WH4043> for me; my glory <WH3519>, and the lifter up <WH7311> of mine head <WH7218>.
I cried <WH7121> unto the LORD <WH3068> with my voice <WH6963>, and he heard <WH6030> me out of his holy <WH6944> hill <WH2022>. Selah <WH5542>.
I laid me down <WH7901> and slept <WH3462>; I awaked <WH6974>; for the LORD <WH3068> sustained <WH5564> me.
I will not be afraid <WH3372> of ten thousands <WH7233> of people <WH5971>, that have set <WH7896> themselves against me round about <WH5439>.

Arise <WH6965>, O LORD <WH3068>; save <WH3467> me, O my God <WH430>: for thou hast smitten <WH5221> all mine enemies <WH341> upon the cheek bone <WH3895>; thou hast broken <WH7665> the teeth <WH8127> of the ungodly <WH7563>.
Salvation <WH3444> belongeth unto the LORD <WH3068>: thy blessing <WH1293> is upon thy people <WH5971>. Selah <WH5542>.
